text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Pastaza |official_name = Province of Pastaza |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = Province |total_type = |motto = Construyendo desarrollo |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_flag = Bandera Provincia Pastaza.svg |flag_size = |image_seal = |seal_size = |image_shield = |shield_size = |image_map = Pastaza in Ecuador (+Galapagos).svg |mapsize = |map_caption = Pastaza Province in Ecuador |image_map1 = Cantones de Pastaza.png |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = Cantons of Pastaza Province |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = |pushpin_map_caption = |pushpin_mapsize = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = |seat_type = Capital |seat = Puyo |parts_type = Cantons |parts_style = coll |parts = |p1 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_party = |leader_title = Prefect |leader_name = Antonio Kubes |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |established_title = Pastaza |established_date = November 10, 1959 |extinct_title = |extinct_date = |founder = Government of Ecuador |named_for = The Pastaza River |area_magnitude = |unit_pref = Metric |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = 29641.37 |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_max_footnotes= |elevation_min_footnotes= |elevation_m = |elevation_max_m = |elevation_min_m = |population_as_of = 2010 census |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 83933 |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone1 = ECT |utc_offset1 = -5 |coor_pinpoint = |coordinates = | blank_name_sec2 = HDI (2017) | blank_info_sec2 = 0.724 · 14th |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |postal2_code_type = |postal2_code = |area_code_type = |area_code = |registration_plate = S |website = |footnotes = }} Pastaza () is a province in Ecuador in the eastern jungle. The capital is Puyo, founded on May 12, 1899. == Cantons == The province is divided into four cantons. The following table lists each with its population at the 2001 census, its area in square kilometres (km²), and the name of the canton seat or capital.Cantons of Ecuador. Statoids.com. Retrieved 4 November 2009. Canton Pop. (2001) Area (km²) Seat/Capital Arajuno 5,150 8,767 Arajuno Mera 8,088 520 Mera Pastaza 45,512 19,727 Puyo Santa Clara 3,029 311 Santa Clara ==References==
